message.content:
I need to identify the line item in the cash flow statement that represents a decrease in amounts owed to the entity for goods or services sold on credit.

In a cash flow statement, accounts receivable represents money owed to the entity by customers who purchased goods or services on credit. An increase in accounts receivable means more money is owed to the company (negative cash flow), while a decrease means more customers paid their debts (positive cash flow).

Looking at the cash flow statement provided, I can see the line item:
"(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable" with a value of "-2923459.19"

The negative value indicates this is an increase in accounts receivable (more money owed to the company), which represents a decrease in cash. This is the item that tracks changes in amounts owed to the entity for goods or services sold on credit.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '-2923459.19'}}
```
